text:
Hello :wave-yeti:
I'm trying to create a webhook subscription in my app through the HubSpot API.

I'm using the API key that I generated in "Manage apps" -> "Get HubSpot API key"

The response from the API is: "The API key provided is invalid. View or manage your API key here: <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/api-key/>"

My app is not listed yet, could this be the problem? :man-shrugging:

Let me know if you need any more info!
is this also happening when you create a different API Key?
Yes, I've tried to generate a new one. Same error
maybe, what you are trying to achieve is only allowed with OAuth as an Authentication Method?!
I wish, but POST `/webhooks/v3/{appId}/subscriptions`  does not support OAuth authentication, only API key.

Hey <@U02FB3XDK9B> You need a different kind of API key. To set up webhook subscriptions, you need to create a developers account, which has a developer API key which can configure app settings, vs portal values.  Webhooks must be a part of the an app, which is why you need to set it up this way. You can sign up for a developer account <https://developers.HubSpot.com/get-started|from here>
I am using the developer account (see top banner in image) which I used to create the app. And I got the API key by clicking on "Get HubSpot API key" as you can see in the image.
Ok thanks for the detail, I think this may be relate to an issue I saw recently where the account is in the EU, Iâ€™ll check in on that for you
